title: Star Shaped Font
content:
Hi, I have been to a few identify typography websites and some can not read all the characters individually and even if they do so, none are remotely similar to the font in which is disclosed below.

Would love to find it.

Thank you for your help.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SSilv_5265.jpg)
author: auroraspirit

comments.content: Closest i can think of is Popstars from Harold Lohner [http://haroldsfonts.com/portfolio/popstars/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/haroldsfonts.com/portfolio/popstars/ "http://haroldsfonts.com/portfolio/popstars/")

Might not be a digital font as such. There are a number of clip-art starry patterned letters used on websites, such as this one [http://www.clipartof.com/interior\_wall\_decor/details/Font-Set-Of-Blue-St...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/www.clipartof.com/interior_wall_decor/details/Font-Set-Of-Blue-Starry-Patterned-Letters-Numbers-And-Punctuation-Poster-Art-Print-31589 "http://www.clipartof.com/interior\_wall\_decor/details/Font-Set-Of-Blue-Starry-Patterned-Letters-Numbers-And-Punctuation-Poster-Art-Print-31589") which has a similar starry pattern, but placed on different letter-forms. Also [http://www.shutterstock.com/pic-77521765/stock-vector-starry-alphabet.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/www.shutterstock.com/pic-77521765/stock-vector-starry-alphabet.html "http://www.shutterstock.com/pic-77521765/stock-vector-starry-alphabet.html") and [http://www.shutterstock.com/pic-156577886/stock-photo-illustration-of-th...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/www.shutterstock.com/pic-156577886/stock-photo-illustration-of-the-letters-of-the-alphabet-in-different-colors-on-a-gray-background.html?src=Ftiu1YQyoNMOthnqawQrPw-1-83 "http://www.shutterstock.com/pic-156577886/stock-photo-illustration-of-the-letters-of-the-alphabet-in-different-colors-on-a-gray-background.html?src=Ftiu1YQyoNMOthnqawQrPw-1-83")  
Don

As for similar fonts, here is one called By Starlight [http://www.fontriver.com/font/by\_starlight/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/www.fontriver.com/font/by_starlight/ "http://www.fontriver.com/font/by\_starlight/")  
Also Oh my God Stars [http://www.fontriver.com/font/oh\_my\_god\_stars/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/www.fontriver.com/font/oh_my_god_stars/ "http://www.fontriver.com/font/oh\_my\_god\_stars/")  
Includes a link to the fontmaker's site.  
also Stars TFB [http://www.fontriver.com/font/stars\_tfb/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/www.fontriver.com/font/stars_tfb/ "http://www.fontriver.com/font/stars\_tfb/")  
Includes a link to the fontmaker's site.  
Strars [House of Lime] [http://font.downloadatoz.com/font,5699,stars.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/font.downloadatoz.com/font,5699,stars.html "http://font.downloadatoz.com/font,5699,stars.html")  
Pentagon [House of Lime] [http://www.dafont.com/pentagon.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/www.dafont.com/pentagon.font "http://www.dafont.com/pentagon.font")  
Don
It looks like the same pattern of stars pasted over the outline letters - notice how some land outside the lines. makes me think it is not a font but more a combine technique.

Thanks guys that was brilliant I agree with it being ckipart some of the links given for the star were very similar.

Thank you heaps.

It's a freeware font called **Starlight Sans JL** by Jeffrey N. Levine [2001]  
More info on the designer:  
 [http://luc.devroye.org/jefflevine.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/luc.devroye.org/jefflevine.html "http://luc.devroye.org/jefflevine.html")

According to the copyright note in the font, this is "Sans Poster Bold JL" reworked with a starry effect. My initial impression is that "Sans Poster Bold JL" is not a rip of another font-maker's work. So here is a link to "Starlight Sans JL" [http://www.fonts2u.com/starlight-sans-jl.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150418123859/http:/www.fonts2u.com/starlight-sans-jl.font "http://www.fonts2u.com/starlight-sans-jl.font")  
Note that Jeff Levine's website, "Jeff's Fonts & Dingbats" has expired.  
Don

Oh wow, it is too Starlight Sans JL font.

Thank you :)
